channel.title: Computer Speed
channel.description:
Recently my computer speed went to complete shit. My internet has been the same, I haven't downloaded anything. I have 75% of CPMemory left, I have scanned my computer with MWB three times today, and I even did CCleaner; yet my computer is still acting really damn slow.
Any suggestions other than wiping my hard drive?

item.title: Computer Speed
item.dc:creator: @Sinned Sinned
item.description:
@Sinned wrote:

How many processes do you have running? And do you clean the dead registry entries via CCleaner?

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Speed
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

it’s funny because one of XP’s main slowdown flaws is the registry which is just a pile of archaic shite inherited from 3.1 that should never have been there in the first place.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Speed
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:10, topic:442167”][quote author=Niall link=topic=544817.msg3995141#msg3995141 date=1337168239]
it is well known that windows xp installs slow down with time, there’s nothing you can do to improve it bar a fresh install
[/quote]Why do they slow down? Don’t all computers naturally slow down due to heat/dust?[/quote]Because the registry becomes cluttered and makes simple tasks take longer just because there’s more to search through. Plus more services get installed and ran, along with startup programs. Maintaining these things will keep your computer running smooth.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Speed
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

You could:
dust the computer fans out or any other dust with a air compressor, vaccum cleaner, or one of those air bottle things for computers
Disk Cleanup
Delete Cookies from cookies folder
Upgrade your RAM CARD to like a 4gb or something
Windows Update
Buy a new power outlet cable

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Speed
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:

[quote=“Niall, post:9, topic:442167”]it is well known that windows xp installs slow down with time, there’s nothing you can do to improve it bar a fresh install[/quote]Why do they slow down? Don’t all computers naturally slow down due to heat/dust?

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Speed
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Start -> Run -> msconfig -> Startup -> Make yours look similar to the above.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Speed
item.dc:creator: @someone2 someone2
item.description:
@someone2 wrote:

Try SmartClose. It closes all the useless things running in the background.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Speed
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:5, topic:442167”][quote author=t4 link=topic=544817.msg3994095#msg3994095 date=1337027049]
minimize your footprint on the processor, clean up the disk, else get new hardware.
[/quote]Minimizing my footprint? As in?[/quote]
I think he just means reduce the workload you put on your proccessor. Like a lot of the time I don’t use Spotify but I always have it on which is a waste of cpu.

Read full topic
